page.title: 04SPORT and RECREATION
page.content: In 1980 the village sports and recreation ground was opened by the Village Playing Fields Committee. It has a football pitch, a tennis court and various children's games. Further recreation is found near the beautiful River Tees. Access across the river is by the Winston arch ridge built in 1763 and survived the floods of 1771 which carried off other bridges on the River Tees. There are p-leasant walks both east and west along the river where in the spring an abundance of bluebells and primroses blooms. Fishing with one exception is leased to Stockton Angling Association. The exception is that stretch of the river owned by St. Andrew's Church. Villagers only are allowed to fish here.
